name: mcp-neo4j-cypher
description: Execute read and write Cypher queries on your Neo4j database.
long_description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Neo4j graph databases using Cypher queries. Supports both read and write operations with proper validation and error handling.

tools.name: get_neo4j_schema
tools.description: Retrieve the schema of the Neo4j database, including node labels, properties, and relationships. Requires that APOC plugin is installed.

tools.name: read_neo4j_cypher
tools.description: Execute read-only Cypher queries (MATCH, RETURN, etc.) on the Neo4j database

tools.name: write_neo4j_cypher
tools.description: Execute write Cypher queries (CREATE, MERGE, SET, DELETE, etc.) on the Neo4j database

neo4j_username.title: Neo4j Username
neo4j_username.description: The username for logging into Neo4j

neo4j_password.title: Neo4j Password
neo4j_password.description: The password for logging into Neo4j

neo4j_database.title: Neo4j Database
neo4j_database.description: The database to use in Neo4j, defaults to neo4j

neo4j_uri.title: Neo4j URI
neo4j_uri.description: The URI for connecting to Neo4j

neo4j_namespace.title: Namespace
neo4j_namespace.description: An optional namespace for the MCP server tools

transport.title: Transport
transport.description: The MCP transport, defaults to stdio

mcp_server_host.title: MCP Server Host
mcp_server_host.description: The host for the MCP server, if not using stdio. Defaults to 127.0.0.1

mcp_server_port.title: MCP Server Port
mcp_server_port.description: The port for the MCP server, if not using stdio. Defaults to 8000

mcp_server_path.title: MCP Server Path
mcp_server_path.description: The path for the MCP server, if not using stdio. Defaults to /mcp/
